annual crop land: Different shapes and patterns of fields
Soil exposure between rows of plants
forest: Presence of underbrush or groundcover plants
Multiple vertical layers of vegetation, including:
brushland or shrubland: Presence of native shrubs and grasses
Presence of wildflowers or non-crop plants
industrial buildings or commercial build: Utilitarian exterior materials like metal or concrete
large structures with signs, logos, or company names
pasture land: Presence of grazing animals (e.g., cows, sheep)
farm-related structures (like barns or silos) if present
permanent crop land: Absence of roads, driveways, and parking areas
Fences or boundaries typical of agricultural land
Less visible soil: Due to permanent plants covering much of the ground.
river: Trees or vegetation along the banks in a linear pattern
possible presence of wildlife like fish or waterfowl
Reflections of the sky or trees on the surface of the water
lake or sea: reflections of the sky or surrounding landscape in the water
